author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of the CBM College in the city picketed the Collectorate and the office of the Joint Director of Collegiate Education at Race Course on Tuesday afternoon urging the government to take over the college.

The students said that following the college administration’s failure to pay the electricity bill, power supply to the college was disconnected last week. “The college laboratories cannot function without power supply,” they said.

Following the protest in front of the office of the Joint Director of Collegiate Education, the college secretary was called for talks.

Later in the evening, the students said that the college administration had agreed to pay the electricity bill and they were calling off the protest. They threatened to go on strike if the assurance was not fulfilled.
title: Private college students picket Collectorate
